text.section: If ownership of a vessel is transferred by operation of law, such as by inheritance, order in bankruptcy, insolvency, replevin, or execution sale, the transferee, within 30 days after the transferee has acquired the right to possession of the vessel by operation of law, shall mail or deliver to the Department satisfactory proof of the transferee's ownership as the Department requires, together with his application for a new certificate of title, and the required fee. A title tax is not required on these transactions.

section.section: A secured party that repossesses a vessel is not required to pay the title tax.
On submission of the certification to it, the Department may issue a new certificate of title if it is satisfied that the secured party is entitled to one.
